title: MLB rumors: Orioles' Manny Machado could be next Phillies superstar
text:
comments 
For the rebuilding Phillies , the 2017 season is about choosing building blocks and which young players will be on the next winning team in Philadelphia. 
With a farm system brimming with talent and oodles of money to spend on the open market when the time is right, current Phillies should start feeling pressure. 
Perform or be replaced by more talented athletes. 
When the highly-touted free-agent class of 2018-19 (following the 2018 season) emerges, expect the Phillies to be involved on big names. That includes current Baltimore Orioles star Manny Machado. As CSN Philly recently brought up , Machado's eventual free agency makes 2017 something of a make-or-break year for current third baseman Maikel Franco. 
Here's why the speculation is warranted and Machado could eventually be the next big thing at Citizens Bank Park. 
-Franco is far from a sure thing. 
For as promising as Franco was as a rookie (130 OPS+) in 2015, last season represented a huge step back (96 OPS+) in offensive production. Plus, despite passing the eye test for many fans, Franco's defense (minus-6 runs saved, negative defensive WAR) rated below average last season. 
Among third basemen with at least 350 plate appearances in 2016, Franco's 1.2 WAR ranked 27 of 29. Franco has upside, but he was one of the worst players at his position last season. 
-Andy MacPhail, Matt Klentak drafted Machado in Baltimore. 
This is important. The relationship between MacPhail and Klentak goes back to their days running the Orioles. In 2009, armed with the third pick in the draft, the duo selected Machado. The pick set Baltimore up to become one of baseball's best teams over the last five years. 
-Machado is worth a record-setting contract, and the O's aren't poised to pay it. 
Make no mistake: Machado is going to get headline-worthy money. A deal in excess of $350M (if not over $400M) is possible, if not likely. The crazy part? Machado will be worth it. 
Over the last two years, Machado's 13.7 WAR ranks fourth among all big league position players. According to Fangraphs , he's been worth $106.1M over the last two years, and $169.3M from his age 20-23 seasons. Machado will hit free agency after his age-25 season--meaning his prime and pre-decline years are still to come. 
We're talking about a special player off to a ridiculous career start. Yet, the Orioles reportedly haven't made a legitimate attempt to keep him long term. 
Phillies predictions 
-Better investment than Bryce Harper? 
As Bryce Harper free agency rumors swirled during the offeason, the Phillies came up as a logical destination . 
But Machado could be seen as a better long-term investment for Philadelphia. Last season, Machado topped Harper in the following categories: WAR, OPS, HR, OPS+, total bases and extra-base hits. 
Plus, with Philadelphia's slew of outfield options (Dylan Cozens, Cornelius Randolph, Nick Williams, Mickey Moniak ) in the system, Machado may make more sense as a long-term answer at third base.
